intro: Calpidia gigantocarpa, commonly known as the giant fruit calpidia, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, fleshy, orange-colored fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces showy, yellowish flowers with a distinct, fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. Its leaves are broad and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy coating. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Calpidia gigantocarpa is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
